title: Paris 2024: Simone Biles and Team USA win artistic gymnastics gold
summary: Four-time Rio 2016 Olympic medalist Biles got her revenge on having had to forfeit most events at the Tokyo 2021 Olympics, aided by Team USA's dominant performance.

title: Israeli army announces it 'eliminated' Hezbollah commander in Beirut strike
summary: The Israeli army announced on Tuesday, July 30, that it had targeted the 'responsible' for the deaths of 12 children in a rocket attack on the Israeli-annexed Golan Heights village of Majdal Shams last Saturday.

title: Silicon Valley backs Harris but hopes for compensation
summary: The US vice president, in all probability the Democratic presidential candidate against Donald Trump, is seen as more pro-business than Joe Biden.

title: Paris shifts position and recognizes Morocco's sovereignty over Western Sahara
summary: Risking a new crisis with Algeria, French President Emmanuel Macron wrote in a letter to king Mohammed VI, that the territory's future falls 'within the context of Moroccan sovereignty.'

title: Italy returns to Damascus, twelve years after its last ambassador's departure
summary: Giorgia Meloni's government has appointed a permanent representative in the Syrian capital for the first time since 2012. This decision signals the beginning of a re-engagement with Bashar al-Assad's regime, a move that other European countries might soon follow.

title: On the Italian coast, the sands of seclusion
summary: 'Beaches of Italy' (1/6). From the shores of the Mediterranean to those of the Adriatic, Italy's countless beaches tell tales of splendor and hardship. Many are privately owned and managed by 6,592 seaside resorts, determined to safeguard this typically Italian business.

title: Philippe Katerine: 'The most beautiful thing about the Christian faith is forgiveness'
summary: In an interview with Le Monde, the French singer responds to the controversy surrounding his performance at the opening ceremony of the Paris Olympics on Friday.

title: Tesla involved in crash that killed motorcyclist was using self-driving system, authorities report
summary: Washington State Patrol says Tesla involved in an April crash that killed a motorcyclist near Seattle was operating on a self-driving system. Police's spokesperson declared on Tuesday, July 30, "the investigation is still ongoing in this case," adding that no charges had been filed so far.

title: Biden, Lula, call on Venezuelan authorities to release detailed presidential election voting data
summary: Caracas' electoral authorities have said President Nicolas Maduro won, but the opposition says their candidate, Edmundo Gonzalez, secured more than twice as many votes in last Sunday's election.

title: Far right supporters storm Negev military detention center in Israel
summary: Led by ultranationalist elected officials and ministers, a crowd stormed the Sde Teiman base to protest the arrest of nine reservists suspected of having raped a Palestinian detainee.

title: Paris 2024: Thierry Henry, a coach in search of legitimacy
summary: The French football star has a key opportunity to prove himself, at 46, as a coach in a major competition. The French Olympic team is playing against New Zealand on Tuesday at 7 pm.

title: Greek athletes ran and fought to get their statues in Zeus' sanctuary
summary: Divided into light sports, such as athletics, and heavy sports, like boxing and pankration, ancient Olympic sports led to the crowning of champions, deemed to have been chosen by the gods.

title: The methods explored by researchers to cure HIV
summary: Encouraging results to definitively eliminate the virus were presented at the recent International AIDS Conference in Munich.

title: Surfing events postponed due to weather conditions in Teahupo'o
summary: French surfers Kauli Vaast and Joan Duru qualified for the quarter-finals on Monday, July 29. The outcome of the duel between France's Vahine Fierro and Johanne Defay will have to wait.

title: Third child dies after knife attack in England
summary: The attack happened when children were attending a Taylor Swift-themed class at a dance school in Southport, near Liverpool, on Monday.

title: Democrats' enthusiasm for Kamala Harris: 'It's reminiscent of Obama in 2008'
summary: In the swing state of Pennsylvania, Democratic activists want to believe that Kamala Harris' candidacy will rekindle enthusiasm in their ranks, going beyond the mere rejection of Donald Trump.

title: Tearful Gauff in 'cheat' storm after Olympic exit
summary: Coco Gauff of Team USA was eliminated in the Games tennis tournament in a stormy defeat to impressive Donna Vekic of Croatia. Gauuff claimed she was 'getting cheated' in a lengthy argument with the chair umpire over a line call.

title: Paris 2024: French police investigating abuse targeting Olympic opening ceremony DJ
summary: DJ Barbara Butch, an LGBTQ+ icon who performed with drag queens and dancers at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games opening ceremony, has filed a complaint for online abuse and threats, which is under investigation.

title: Biden plans to reform the Supreme Court to fight 'extremism'
summary: The American president wants to limit the terms of office of the nine judges, currently appointed for life, to 18 years. But this change is unlikely to see the light of day before he leaves the White House.

title: Paris 2024: Athletes put to the test by extreme heat
summary: The heatwave that is suffocating the south of France reached Olympic competition venues on Tuesday, July 30. While athletes were prepared for the risk, the extreme temperatures require them to make significant adjustments.

title: Patrick Boucheron: 'We envisioned this Olympic opening ceremony as a manifesto against fear'
summary: The historian worked alongside Thomas Jolly to craft a narrative intended to be unifying. Targeted by the far-right, he hopes to sidestep the pitfalls of controversy.

title: Paris 2024: The opening ceremony's string instruments, under police escort and heavy rain
summary: Faced with inclement weather, the Paris Orchestra made an emergency loan of low-end instruments from the French National Orchestra, which were transported across Paris for the opening ceremony.

title: Paris Olympics: Trump says opening ceremony was 'a disgrace'
summary: The former US president's reaction followed condemnation by catholic authorities, who said the show contained 'scenes of derision and mockery of Christianity.'

title: Paris Olympics: Men's triathlon postponed due to Seine pollution
summary: The first sporting event scheduled to take place in the Seine River was canceled at the last minute. It is now due to take place on Wednesday.

title: Africa, the missing ring of the Olympics
summary: The continent has never hosted Olympic Games since their resurrection in 1896. Above all, it has had a tumultuous relationship with the competition, marked by racist prejudice and the geopolitical context since independence.

title: British Labour discovers £22 billion 'hole' in public finances
summary: In the face of a massive public deficit, Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves announced on Monday, July 29, budget cuts and tax increases. In the City of London, financiers are already strategizing ways to avoid the impacts.

title: Kamala Harris to stand as sole Democratic presidential candidate for official party vote
summary: Despite the early vote to select a nominee, delegates will still convene as planned from August 19 to 22 at the Democratic National Convention in Chicago.

title: US strike kills four in Iraq
summary: The 'defensive' strike was the first by American forces in Iraq since February when the US military said it killed a pro-Iran commander who was involved in attacks on the country's troops.

title: Hamas chief Ismail Haniyeh assassinated in Tehran
summary: One of the most senior Hamas leaders, Haniyeh was targeted and killed in Iran on Wednesday, July 31, according to a statement by Iran's Revolutionary Guards Corps.

title: 'The Decameron' on Netflix: A series that brings buboes
summary: Inspired by rather than adapted from the work of Florentine writer Boccaccio, these eight episodes strike a balance between comedy and danse macabre.

title: Paris 2024: Triathlon gets green light as hero Marchand bids for more Olympic golds
summary: Wednesday will be all about the water in Paris as the water in the Seine was deemed clean enough for the triathlon and swimming legend Leon Marchand swims in two more finals

title: Macron looks to use Olympic 'political truce' to hone his plan for a new prime minister
summary: Emmanuel Macron is spending some time at the presidential holiday residence in southern France, still looking for a prime minister who could create consensus on both the left and right.

title: Paris 2024: France's Cassandre Beaugrand takes triathlon gold
summary: With Paris streets still slippy after overnight rain showers, the French athlete was first across the line on Wednesday, followed by Switzerland's Julie Derron and Britain's Beth Potter.

title: Paris 2024 Olympics: Ukraine's Marta Kostyuk carries the hopes of a nation
summary: Highly outspoken about the war in Ukraine, the young tennis player has recently become more reserved. She has qualified for the quarterfinals.
